subject: Wow
event:
Great Superbowl.  I had no strong rooting interest this year, but this game was still a treat for any fan of the NFL brand of football.  As exciting as last year's game, if not as well played, with several incredible plays that will live in Superbowl lore.  Both teams played valiantly, and those last few minutes no doubt stopped a few hearts.

I did think the officiating was lacking.  The NFL really needs to do a better job than this.  Far too many penalties, many of them with major impact on the game, and some of them bogus (on both teams).  I wish the refs would learn to keep their flags in their pockets unless they are SURE.  Close calls should not draw flags.

Even so... a terrific game, one for the ages.  Congratulations to the Pittsburgh Steelers and their fans.  (And to the Pottsville Maroons and THEIR fans.  Rest easy, guys, your curse is still intact).  

Best half-time show in Superbowl history as well.  BRUUUUUUUCE!  For a moment there I thought he was going to play for three hours, and screw the time limits.  Superbowl halftimes have gotten a lot better of late.  Last year we got Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers.  Before that it was the famous wardrobe malfunction... but hey, even that was better than Up With People, as in decades of yore.  And I'm so old I remember the marching bands that performed at halftime at SuperBowl I.

(And being old, I got a little annoyed during the trophy presentation, when Dan Patrick said that the Steeler's sixth Superbowl win made them "the winningest franchise in NFL history."  Uh, no, not even close.  Sorry, Dan, but NFL history goes back half a century before the first Superbowl, and those championships count too.  The Steelers have six, and that's great for them, but I believe the Chicago Bears still have the most NFL championships total, and the Green Bay Packers and New York Giants are up there too).

And so another NFL season comes to a close.

But the NFL never really ends.

The Detroit Lions are now on the clock.

comments.article:
There are few things in life more satisfying than the end of football season.

Why?

Cos it means baseball is just right around the corner!

dude.. baseball is THE most boring sport in the world.

don't argue with me, lst time that happened it was a girl who kept buyimg me shots and i woke up in her bed

Great game!

How many days until the draft?
I don't entirely feel like we deserved this victory, and agree on the officiation...but it'll do. :-D
Yep...the refs started reaching for flags and pulled out the $500.00 bills that the mafia paid them just like in SB XL.

I've been following the Cardinals success this year somewhat in disbelief and was even more surprised when they almost won the Super Bowl tonight. The Cardinals we're used to seeing definitely had their moments in the game, though. I keep thinking I somehow managed to end up in a parallel universe where the Cardinals made it to the Superbowl. If so, then I expect to see the K.C. Royals make it to the World Series this year. Not likely...
brutal loss.  just brutal.  :(

Oh George. Life is meaningless and has no purpose. :(

But, on the bright side, anytime my friend that's a salivating Cowboys fan gets too uppity, I can now say, "You don't have the most rings anymore."

Picked the Steelers, ended up rooting for the Cardinals. How could I not? I hope the Giants get a star receiver to replace Plax, improve the linebacker corp and remind Coughlin to be his kinder, gentler self.

The halftime show was one of the best that I've seen, and for the first time it was live. To be honest, I don't pay close attention to them. I did catch Janet's wardrobe malfunction, but didn't think anything of it at the time because of the elaborate nipple decor.

Over the past 20 Superbowls, the team I was rooting for has won 5 times. Patriots x 3, Packers in 97, Giants in 91 ... Wow, I've had a lot of depressing Superbowls! This is definitely the second worst (right after last year's of course).

Last year's was just overwhelming sadness, being a hardcore Patriots fan, but at least I didn't have to feel intense hatred towards referees as well. The Giants beat them fair and square. My heart really goes out to Cardinals fans right now. You guys got the shaft! Your coach had to waste two challenge flags on totally blown calls and the Steelers acted like a bunch of thugs for the entire game, and only got called for it a few times. You know how many games I've watched where the coach earns a 3rd challenge because he got the first 2 right? Not too frikkin' many, I'll tell you that!

p.s. My heart will never go out to Raiders fans regarding the "tuck rule" in 2001. Al Davis is a psychopath and deserves all the failure in the world - so you are a moron for even rooting for that cursed team.

I hate you Steelers! I hate you so much!
comments.subject: And .. my team loses again!

comments.article:
As a Seattle resident, I was hoping the Steelers would choke, but I'm still a bit irritated that we got screwed by the refs in XL. I only tuned into the last five minutes of the game, but that was pretty epic by itself.

It was a hard-fought game, though. Congrats to the winners, and a good effort by the losers as well.

comments.upictitle: Random Writings: Enter At Own Risk
comments.article:
The Detroit Lions are now on the clock.

And training camps open in just under six months. :-)

I was disappointed with the outcome but it was certainly an amazing game. The Steelers BARELY outplayed the Cards. I couldn't sit down for most of the 4th quarter...

As far as the refs went... I wish they had reviewed Warner's fumble. At the least, they would have removed any doubt.

What an amazing finish for the Steelers though. Just think... The Steelers fans were just 3 minutes away from crying into their Terrible Towells...

PS...  I still think U2 in 2002 was the best Super Bowl halftime.  And I enjoyed Paul McCartney very much as well.  I noticed that all of the halftime shows are PG rated since the "wardrobe malfunction"

No. Sorry. Prince was the best Superbowl half time show in the history of superbowl half time shows.

Bruce was good. But he's no Prince.
agreed

The Detroit Lions are now on the clock.

...and will squander the pick as always.
they should pick a wide out.

i still lost $50 on the point spread....

i was actually rooting for the cardinals but my money was on the steelers by 7

damm..
Not reviewing that last play was inexcusable.

They did review the last play. It was stated so by Michaels when the camera was coming back to the Ben knee-down, after the commercials. He just mentioned it offhand, didn't make a fuss about it. But he did say the play was reviewed while we were in that last commercial break.
comments.subject: Re: The Crow Feasts

comments.article: Although a 49er fan, I rooted for the Steelers, having pegged them to win it all on this very site a few weeks before the regular season ended.  I think it was after that game against Dallas.  They just had that "aura" about them.  What a fourth quarter.  Compliments to the Cardinals.  I thought they would finally be crushed.  But for that magical end to the first half I'm pretty sure they would have won.
comments.subject: The Crow Feasts

comments.article: Last year's was more exciting, though as a patriots fan, this year's was a lot less depressing. It was a great game to watch.

It was choppy but never lacked for big plays. The 100-yard rumble, the Fitzgerald bolt down the middle, and Santonio Holmes's tapdance in the endzone will all be replayed a thousand times. It was fun to watch. We've had a run of good Super Bowls in recent years.

Now if only the 49ers can get back to their own "glory days"...

You're right about this revisionist version of NFL history that seems to pretend that the NFL started in 1967. Most league titles is 12 by the Packers. The Bears are second with 9 and your beloved New York Football Giants third with 7.
Yes I was just about to say that.  Thanks.  It's important to us Packer fans that the Bears never get credit for anything they deserve, or don't deserve in this case;-)

God, what a game. I think my Colts-fan son may have converted (he begged me to buy him a Santonio Holmes jersey after the game was over).

Afterwards -- fireworks, whistling, shouting, cheering in all directions. We're in the east suburbs of Pittsburgh.

This morning has been very quiet. Schools all over have a two-hour delay.

I am so tired of these old farts playing the half-time show. Can we please forget about the boob thing and get some modern rock or pop in there. Oh, and thanks for the poke at the end. I am from Detroit. You should of seen the commerical the Lions put on the local network. The wanted to thank what fans they had left for not jumpig ship. Sad to say, but, I will always be a fan. I need a drink!
comments.subject: UMMMM! The half-time show was really bad.

comments.article: Hannah Montana!
comments.subject: Re: UMMMM! The half-time show was really bad.
Re: UMMMM! The half-time show was really bad.

comments.article: I thought there was Prince and also the Rolling Stones between Tom Petty/Heartbreakers and the Wardrobe Malfunction... And I agree - they need more modern rock.  Bruce's slide right into the camera was a little over eager, and now someone has a black eye from his groin.

comments.upictitle: Stop drooling at my pic!!!!: Author pose
comments.article: I heard that arizona got a little more than they bargained for with porn intercepting the broadcast. I love the quote from the guy that said "I just assumed it was another commercial until I looked up"

Hey, that comment bugs me too.

I'm not that old and know nothing about American football, but I am English so I tend to get irritated about people murdering the language like that :-)
comments.subject: Annoying 'winningest' comment

comments.article: The officiation was nuts, I felt like I was watching CourtTV. Also, I'm glad I'm not the only one who hated the half-time show. Gene Hoglan said it best: "I have nothing against Bruce Springsteen, except that he sucks."
